result.execSummary:
The defendant James E. Boos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.  A payment plan can be set up with the Clerk's Of Courts for those assessments, fees and surcharges. If payments are not made, a civil judgement, with interest, may be ordered.

AODA assessment and treatment and follow through with treatment recommendations.    Shall not consume or possess alcoholic beverages or controlled substances.  May take prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages. May not go on tavern/bar premises except for employment purposes.

No contact w/victims Not to go within 500 of their residence or place or employment  Not to possess any dangerous weapons  Counseling as deemed necessary by agent. NOT Eligible for Challenge Incarceration & IS eligible for Substance Abuse programs

Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

8:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Kurt B. Zengler in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody. Cases called appearances given.  Victim rights are complied with Victims are not present.  State informs the court that the parties are stipulating to the reports of the doctors.  Defense attorney addresses the court. They have reviewed the report and the doctor report states that the deft is competent to proceed with the cases.  Court addresses the parties and will resume with the cases.  Defense would like to schedule and plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
